level.heading: DEFINITIONS (§ 20-3599) Aggregated utility data – total whole-building energy or water data for apecified period as provided by the utility company or a third party for theuilding for a given utility type. Building – any structure used or intended for supporting or sheltering any user occupancy. Building owner – an individual, partnership, corporation, trust, association,irm, joint stock company, organization, commission, or other private entityither possessing title or designated to govern a privately-owned building, orn agent authorized to act on behalf of the private entity. Director – the Director of the District Department of the Environment (DDOE),r the Director’s representative, agent, designee, or successor. District Benchmark Results and Compliance Report – the Portfolio Managereport that includes benchmark results, identifies reporting methodology, andonfirms completion of a building’s benchmarking to the District. District Benchmark Reporting Template – the template developed by DDOE inartnership with the United States Environmental Protection Agency (U.S. EPA),hat exports from Portfolio Manager the building information required foruilding owners to fulfill District benchmarking requirements. District Data Collection Worksheet – the list of data fields required toulfill District benchmarking requirements. ENERGY STAR® Portfolio Manager benchmarking tool, or Portfolio Manager – theystem developed by the U.S. EPA that rates the energy and water performance of building. Non-Residential Tenant Information Form – the District form a building owneray use to collect information required for benchmarking from a non-residentialenant. Non-Residential Tenant Notification Letter – the District form letter auilding owner may use to inform a non-residential tenant that the tenant isequired to provide the information required for benchmarking. Space use attributes – information such as the conditioned floor area, weeklyperating hours, number of occupied units, and number of computers in use asefined by the Portfolio Manager, according to a building type. Tenant – a person or entity entitled to the possession, occupancy, or theenefits of any rental unit owned by another person or entity. Utility company – an entity distributing, supplying, or transmittinglectricity, natural gas, or other fuel for heating, cooling, or powereneration, or water to a building. Utility data – energy or water consumption data from one or more meters for apecified period.
SOURCE
level.text: Final Rulemaking published at 55 DCR 11318 (October 31, 2008); asmended by Final Rulemaking published at 60 DCR 367 (January 18, 2013).
